column4: hi.  i've installed ubuntu 6.06 LTS on my laptop, when I try to install my WinXP driver for wireless with ndiswrapper, I get - "couldn't copy /ian/Temp/neti2220.inf at /usr/sbin/ndiswrapper line 135.".  how do i fix this?
are you doing something obscure that requires ndiswrapper?  I haven't needed it for anything wireless
no, i don't think so.  needed to install ndiswrapper with suse on my laptop too.
6.06 should be able to do almost any normal wireless thing you want without ndiswrapper
you mean my wireless card is supported in 6.06?
sure what kind is it?  I have never had to use ndiswrapper I think it's just a headache
I've always had to use. my card is a cisco one... ipn2220 or something
is your card in now?  you should be able to see it with ifconfig -a
not on my laptop now, but can check.  back in a min.
ifconfig -a shows an eth0, lo, and a sit0
ok then I guess you have a special card.  I have used cisco lmc352 and cb21ag without ndiswrapper
ok.  I have always had to use ndiswrapper.  so, why isn't it installing?
it is not a cisco card, it is an INPROCOMM.
ok. i will check out the docs. thanks.
